DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To assess whether reduce compute tomography ( CT ) schedule magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) could use safe effective alternative standard CT-based surveillance management patient stage I seminoma testis . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients randomize 1 4 surveillance arm . - Arm I : Patients undergo compute tomography ( CT ) scan abdomen/retroperitoneum* 6 , 12 , 18 , 24 , 36 , 48 , 60 month absence disease progression . - Arm II : Patients undergo CT scan abdomen/retroperitoneum* 6 , 18 , 36 month absence disease progression . - Arm III : Patients undergo magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) abdomen/retroperitoneum* 6 , 12 , 18 , 24 , 36 , 48 , 60 month absence disease progression . - Arm IV : Patients undergo MRI abdomen/retroperitoneum* 6 , 18 , 36 month absence disease progression . NOTE : *Patients history ipsilateral inguino-scrotal surgery also undergo image pelvis . Patients complete questionnaire baseline periodically study assess health-related quality life ; utilization cost healthcare service ( include cost CT- MRI-based surveillance management recurrence ) ; acceptability allocate scan schedule . Patients follow every 3 month 2 year , every 4 month 1 year , every 6 month 3 year .
